alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT THE CENTRAL CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virginia Beach, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Virginia Beach around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rudee Heights, Dam Neck, Macons Corner, Sigma, Pungo, and Sandbridge Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings.
